documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
, no act of a kind which simply must not be done,
even rape, to use Dr. Craig‘s example. If this God exists, and we must obey him
unconditionally, then anything whatever might turn out to be permissible. This
view is destructive of morality as we normally think of it.
So there you have my opening argument. I have offered seven objections,
seven deadly objections, I would say, to Christian theism: it is committed to
predestination, to Hell, to original sin, to justification by faith, and to exclu
